text:
I don't know where to post this question. So here it goes.
Is it true that we can't stage blog and blog posts?

Morning all - Happy Monday

Curious to see if anyone here has created an actionable slack feed (or something else) for HS community announcements etc?

While we're signed up to email notifications, and can look at the developer announcements board, etc - Things can still be missed... So it would be good to post up somewhere when an announcement is made and allocate it out to various teams to read and sign off as ok/action if needed.

Community post tags like `Breaking Changes`, `Announcement`, `API` from this post would be very helpful - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Developer-Announcements/Increasing-the-size-of-contact-record-IDs/td-p/890611>
Just found another post on the topic - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/128172-RevOps-Discussions/Feeding-HubSpot-Product-Updates-to-Slack-channel/td-p/855574>

Reminder: Did you know you can message <@U02162GK9SP|sprocky> at any time to get HubSpot development questions answered? It’s an experimental chat bot built to tackle developer questions. It won’t read your code, but can answer a lot of questions about building on the HubSpot platform.
<@U02162GK9SP> Can you help me understand how to get companies and their associated contacts?

Contacts are the primary type of object in HubSpot, they are used to personalize marketing, sales and aid service to your contacts. We have an API that enables you to take action on contact data, including sync it with other tools.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
<@U02162GK9SP> What are some examples of ui extensions?

For websites, themes, templates, modules etc. We have an open source theme boilerplate that you can reference, use code from, and even start a new site from. It shows both an opinionated way you can structure your files, and some best practices. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/HubSpot-cms-boilerplate>
I answered you in a different channel - api I think
Hmmm... You can post-date them to not publish until a certain date.

<https://www.loom.com/share/65668186db624005a474edf85ffb34a3?sid=f926f38f-f102-4a36-85c3-dba574f4d5c7>

Woah, this has been a long time coming. Excited that it's finally here!

Hey <@U06Q1FWGLUS>, self-promotion is only permitted in our <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> channel, as per our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct#unwanted-solicitation-of-services|code of conduct>. I'm deleting this post. I'm curious, if you do re-post in <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase>, can you explain what the benefit would be for HubSpot developers to join your Discord? If there isn't a clear connection I'd ask you not to re-post at all.
Hey <@UP452DA2Z>, are you subscribed to the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|HubSpot Developer Changelog>? That'll be your best bet to stay updated on all these things.
<@U01QVR44MEY> seen anything about how to set these via API?
Like creating a file field through the API?
or submitting a file through the API?
submitting the file
I would assume maybe you would still need to upload the file into File Manager and then set the property value to be a reference to it in File Manager?
Yeah that's definitely one way to do it, I've also hooked into the public (but undocumented) endpoint for the form apis
Hey I'm new to this, I'm having some issues with a theme I'm trying to make, where could I ask a question??
